name: Siberian Husky
description: The Siberian Husky is energetic, intelligent, and free-spirited — a striking breed known for its blue eyes, endurance, and pack-loving nature. Friendly yet independent, Huskies make wonderful companions for active families.

adaptability.description: Siberian Huskies thrive in colder climates due to their thick double coat. In hot weather, ensure shade, hydration, and avoid midday walks.

diet.title: DIET
diet.mainDescription: Siberian Huskies need a high-energy, protein-focused diet to support their active metabolism and maintain lean muscle.

tips.title: High protein content
tips.description: Provide 25–30% protein-rich meals from sources like fish, chicken, or lamb to meet their energy demands.

tips.title: Healthy fats for energy
tips.description: Huskies use fat efficiently. Include Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids to sustain energy and promote coat shine.

tips.title: Moderate portions
tips.description: Huskies self-regulate food intake. Provide smaller, frequent meals rather than large portions to prevent bloating.

tips.title: Hydration is crucial
tips.description: Ensure constant access to clean, cool water—especially in warm weather—to prevent dehydration.

training.title: SIBERIAN HUSKY TRAINING
training.mainDescription: Siberian Huskies are intelligent but strong-willed. Positive reinforcement, patience, and consistent structure are vital for obedience and discipline.

tips.title: Channel their energy
tips.description: Provide daily vigorous exercise — running, hiking, or playing fetch to satisfy their stamina and prevent boredom.

tips.title: Crate & recall training
tips.description: Teach recall early and use crate training for discipline, as Huskies have a natural instinct to wander.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Huskies have a dense double coat that sheds seasonally. Regular grooming keeps their coat healthy and reduces shedding.
grooming.mainDescription: Siberian Huskies require frequent brushing during shedding seasons and moderate maintenance throughout the year.

tips.title: Brush regularly
tips.description: Brush 2–3 times per week using a de-shedding brush to manage loose undercoat and maintain airflow to skin.

tips.title: Bath & coat care
tips.description: Bathe every 6–8 weeks. Avoid overbathing as it strips natural oils; use a mild shampoo formulated for double coats.
